intro: Howardia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
